metadata.title: CVE-2015-1341 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Any Python module in sys.path can be imported if the command line of theprocess triggering the coredump is Python and the first argument is -m inApport before 2.19.2 function _python_module_path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1341` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
apport-gtk - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
apport-kde - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
apport-noui - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
apport-retrace - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
apport-valgrind - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
dh-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
python-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
python-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
python3-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
python3-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.1-0ubuntu3.18').
